glimmr 0.1.0.9000

Process GASMET data

Source: R/devices.R
process_gasmet.Rd

Process GASMET data

process_gasmet(gasmet, meta, V = 0.01461, A = 0.098, pre = F, wndw = 10,
  offset = 0)

Arguments

gasmet

data frame; Recordings from GASMET.
meta

data frame; Metainformations, see 'Details'.
V

numeric; Chamber Volume. Default to 0.01461.
A

numeric; Chamber Area. Default to 0.098.
pre

if TRUE don't process the flux calculation and return the preprocessed dataframe. When FALSE (the default) data is processed with routines from 'gasfluxes' package and the fluxes are returned.
wndw

numeric; Default to 10. Number of datapoints per measurement. Can be overruled in metadata file. See 'Details'.
offset

numeric; Default to 0. Number of datapoints skipped at the beginning. Can be overruled in metadata file. See 'Details'.

Value

data frame with flux data in mmol m-2 d-1

Details

Flux calculation needs a GASMET datafile and a file containing metadata. Expected fields in the meta file are:

  • spot: character; ID of the measurement location.

  • day: character; Date of the measurement.

  • begin: character; Exact start of the measurement in the format HH:MM:SS. Ideally directly copied from the GASMET File.

  • temp: number; Temperature inside the chamber during measurement.

  • wndw: (optional) Number of datapoints per measurement. Function parameter is used if not provided (default: 10).

  • offset: (optional) Number of datapoints skipped at the beginning. Function parameter is used if not provided (default: 0).

The function splits the GASMET File into chunks containing the single chamber applications defined by begin, wndw, and offset. These chunks are passed to the gasfluxes package for the flux calculation and CO2, CH4 and N2O fluxes are returned as single data frame. gasfluxes creates a plot for every single measurement which are saved into a 'pics' subfolder within the working directory.

wndw and offset can be set as function parameters for the whole dataset or individually in the metadata file for every measurement.

Examples

# preprocessing of data (pre=TRUE) returns data frame with chunks ready to
  # pass to 'gasfluxes'.
process_gasmet(gasmet, meta_gasmet, pre=TRUE)
#>       spot        day rep       V     A        Time  CO2mmol    CH4mmol

# prcessing provokes flux calculation for the three gas species
  # (CO2, CH4, N2O).

# NOT RUN {
process_gasmet(gasmet, meta_gasmet)
# }
